intro: Bucida megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf buccina, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are large, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Bucida megaphylla is adapted to coastal and tropical environments, often found in sandy soils near the shoreline.
